sentence: What do you call a banana you want tomorrow in spanish? banana
explanation: A banana is a tropical fruit that can be eaten raw or cooked.  A banana represents a specific day in the future or the concept of wanting an item at a later time.
first_new_sentence: The banana I bought yesterday is ripe and ready to eat.
second_new_sentence: I would like to have a banana for breakfast tomorrow.

sentence: What happens when you double park your frogs? they get toad!
explanation: A toad is an amphibian that is similar to a frog, often living on land. A toad can also refer to the state of being toad, as in being towed or taken away.
first_new_sentence: A common toad was spotted near the pond this morning.
second_new_sentence: The car was toad away for parking in the wrong zone.

sentence: Whats the best part of two lesbians marrying? two cooks in the house.
explanation: A cook is someone who prepares food for others, whether professionally or at home. A cook can also refer to cooking as an action or task.
first_new_sentence: The cook prepared a delicious meal for the family gathering.
second_new_sentence: We will need two cooks to handle the catering for the event.

sentence: Why cant there be a santa pig? pigs dont fit in chimneys.
explanation: To fit means to be of the right size and shape to be placed somewhere. To fit can also mean to be compatible or suitable for a certain circumstance.
first_new_sentence: The box should fit perfectly on the shelf.
second_new_sentence: The new employee did not fit well into the company culture.
